resources.string: 1. The first name of the production, in English, was Round 6. Changed to Squid Game. Interestingly, in Brazil the initial version was kept.

2. Hwang Dong-hyuk, the series creative director, started working on the script in 2008. But he found it too dystopian and violent and that no one would embark on the project. Today the world has become dystopian and violent enough to voraciously consume Round 6.
3. The giant doll from the first episode was not made for the series. It stands at the entrance to a carriage museum in Jincheon, three hours north of Seoul. It became a global meme.

4. The phone number that appears on a business card inviting the main character to participate in the games actually exists. The line s owner said she received up to 4,000 calls in one day, according to the Business Insider website.
5. It was the first performance of Jung Ho-yeon, the female protagonist of the series. She started her career as a model and has been on the cover of Vogue magazine.
A slap in the face: BRL 457.99
